author: Aljosa Mohorovic
title: OctoWars - a game platform
description: Cardano doesn't provide a simple and elegant way to build trading cards and turn based strategies.

assessments.note: The ecosystem is in need of games and this could attract some of that space to cardano but I feel there needs to be more information on how the game will play out, is it pretty much a copy of legends of runeterra or hearthstone for example or something more

The proposal is a draft and doesn't contain enough information to demonstrate its relevance to the challenge. A game with trading cards could certainly use blockchains / dapps / NFTs, but we need to measure what kind of relevant impact this proposal would have on Cardano, so that a dapp is successful needs to be used, needs unique users, volume of transactions and with the minimum amount of information described, it is not possible to identify the potential impact on the challenge.
This is an empty proposal, asking for 125k with no milestones, technical docs, metrics..

Games are always great gateways into adoption. Building upon Cardano would bring great utility and use case. However, this proposal is so thing on information - that I have serious concerns about its viability if we don't know more information. It really is just few sentences long.
This is lacking a lot of detail
A single developer with the described experience is great but there is no mention of a team, existing code or direction on how the money will  e spent so cannot rate higher than 2

No plan has been described. The proposer described 20 years of software development, building products for the web, but there is no link to GitHub or Linkedin to check his skills or experiences. There is no indication that the proposer has experience with smart contracts. There are not enough details to indicate successful implementation.
Got no information at all on this proposal beyond the simple diagrams in the attached section.

I am afraid that this proposal has not been completed in depth. I recall this from previous funding round but I think it used to have more information in it? Unsure if this is some diluted version perhaps. In any case - having said that - adding relevant experience that we can follow up with - such as professional web/links etc. that would be really helpful. Again, this time they are omitted entirely. Unsure why. There also isn't any sense of what the budget be used for exactly and how it breaks down. Even in the attached slide deck - there is no relevance given it. That's unfortunate as it would help us determine a sensible plan better.
this project plan is empty and the attachments lack detail

There is simply insufficient information here to know how feasible the idea is. It is asking for a consuderable amount of money with no roadmap or milestones in place. The risk here I think is that its a single developer and it takes way too long to produce the game
not enough depth for the money requested
There is not enough information to check the feasibility of the proposal and how the proposal will address the challenge in an impactful way.
This proposal is extremely early in idea formation. It's missing everything a mature proposal would include.

I wonder if there is a missing attachment of sorts? Because there really isn't enough information on executables to understand where this proposal could go. Having better roadmap/milestones, metrics to measure its progress, challenges, risks - all of these would have been great additions to the proposal. Sadly, it isn't here now.

solution: Build a PoC game and continue development until it's deployed to production. Based on that experience build a game platform.
experience: 20 years of software development, building products for the web.
